contentrichtext.text: {{Nihongo|'''Hiwa'''|比和町|Hiwa-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Hiba District, Hiroshima|Hiba District]], [[Hiroshima Prefecture|Hiroshima]], [[Japan]]. On March 31, 2005 Hiwa, along with the towns of [[Kuchiwa, Hiroshima|Kuchiwa]], [[Saijō, Hiroshima|Saijō]], [[Takano, Hiroshima|Takano]] and [[Tōjō, Hiroshima|Tōjō]], all from [[Hiba District, Hiroshima|Hiba District]], and the town of [[Sōryō, Hiroshima|Sōryō]], from [[Kōnu District, Hiroshima|Kōnu District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Shōbara, Hiroshima|Shōbara]]. As of March 2011, the town had a [[population]] of 1,698 and a [[population density|density]] of 12.93 persons per km². The total area was 131.30 km². ==External links== *[http://www.hiwa.jp/ Hiwa official website] in Japanese [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Hiroshima Prefecture]] {{Hiroshima-geo-stub}}
